5F6495CEE1DA453C8FA3512C641F7B76.description: Demonstrate an understanding that responsible information users draw reasonable conclusions based on analysis and interpretation of information, follow policies when using shared resources, take the initiative to suggest improvements, recognize that choices impact how the information will be used and by whom, and follow up with additional research when inconsistencies are encountered

3648F9C3ED594EEE84640E5CA0CFCAEC.description: Demonstrate responsible citizenship in use of materials and resources

7F31E178B7514CA28C3353C6324A8969.description: Pursue diverse ideas and world views which challenge a researcher, and which are necessary for informed participation in the social interchange within information ecosystems; and support public disclosure and free access to information

9D99FB5AAD214F3A83AB79B983CBBF9E.description: Advocate for intellectual freedom and uphold the rights of others

249C3C08B5EC48F6868F3523BE3D186D.description: Demonstrate an understanding of and use the normative behavior agreements of the particular discourse community when working in a group for a certain field of study, using more formal parliamentary procedure where required; demonstrate intellectual humility; contribute to the intellectual community rather than remaining only a consumer of information; value and evaluate others’ contributions; and seek guidance from experts

E2EB2EB72D434A7A9431212ABCAFADD0.description: Collaborate as members of a social and intellectual community

204C579ACD194EC9AF5B9FDC2678648F.description: Participate collaboratively, respectfully and productively as a member of a democratic society

CCB886D3A2D94C2CA2C0916DE8F9504C.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the concepts of intellectual property and originality, and use sources within the limitations of copyright law, the allowances of public domain, copyleft (open public copyright), or Creative Commons licenses, and read sources closely to understand the context for the given information to accurately represent the ideas in context

3562C8F862F841869FFA2FE50CB4EBE6.description: Respect the intellectual property of others and copyright law when gathering, presenting, or publishing information

72468932CEFF4D7C954187D80B2ABF4E.description: Within a field of study, use strategies to avoid plagiarism, use subject-specific citation styles, and demonstrate an understanding of the rights and permissions for use of intellectual property, including public domain, and Creative Commons licenses

C92A9830A80948209D5262D5F7C72C40.description: Avoid plagiarism when gathering, presenting, or publishing information

01376E05525649A98C5A44C73E0BD524.description: Provide proper attribution and citations for sources, including identifying all necessary components for a complete citation within each source used, as required by the citation style for the field of study, constructing citations in proper format, differentiating between citation styles, using citation generators, and checking for accuracy

5A45D583B74B4FAD87F1AE55EF20782A.description: Seek accuracy, legitimacy, and reliability in sources, and be objective when searching and reading, and demonstrate an understanding of how particular sources, including crowdsourced, contribute to knowledge within a field of study

EAF22240C64E4B8D8DFD4C7E019A8520.description: Use a variety of authoritative sources, considering multiple perspectives and points of view

A066C9D9486446DFA024FDF633B8130B.description: Practice ethical behavior when using print and digital resources

7A84977B16624ADB999B01AB8E7944ED.description: Critically evaluate contributions made (including one’s own) in a variety of information environments within a field of study, identifying biases, and evaluating the value of various perspectives

28F8E0CAC70C402C9AAB2B002888078A.description: Practice accuracy and consider bias when sharing information

2D8F78647E40461CA1C31A1AC115F7B4.description: In a field of study, as a contributor of information, decide how and where best to contribute; demonstrate an understanding of the safety and ethics involved with commodification of personal information and tracking of online interactions, and share content and interests appropriate to the forum

AE1F2BB1605949C1821B87FF5D4B4E66.description: Participate in and advocate for safe and ethical communication

FF2B0F8E6831419BAA0FC56DA0EB089C.description: Contribute to topical conversations at the appropriate level for the field of study, using accepted vocabulary and discourse; monitor reactions, and adjust participation as necessary

4ECA68B12B054A6B93DD5F72D49F2978.description: Use appropriate language when communicating with others

6B88244E67B64E159DFC122BE7489837.description: Practice ethical behavior to share knowledge

9F5BF371D4BB4CF7AAFDB66DB3532D3E.description: SOCIAL RESPONSIBILITY: Share knowledge and participate ethically and productively as members of a democratic society

874E8FB4ED084E4BA24B602A0FBCAB14.description: Set a reading purpose applicable to the reading task and type of genre in materials specific to the field of study or academic discipline. Use metacognition to track changes and development in one's reading identity

841688616D1A43D1ABC59629B85A1B04.description: Demonstrate resiliency, perseverance, and stamina when reading a variety of texts

C0C65908144A49B796F4CED22A88554D.description: Make connections from a wide variety of texts within a discipline specific or professional/technical context to personal, academic, or professional experience and knowledge

CB62006A22234727A2182CFD6E9A9208.description: Make personal and global connections to the real world when reading a variety of texts

7DC1E4E4698840A8A931C7B6EF349DEF.description: Recognize one’s identity as a reader, and extend reading experiences through a variety of genres and formats within the field of study or academic discipline

E5B61F2D3A8C42DFBF70ACBBE0DA43CE.description: Self-select reading materials from a variety of genres and formats

91E55AA23C634CD0AC164DFE5C38CDB2.description: Participate in reading and learning communities, to develop skills for increased academic conversations, and to further research and inquiry within the field of study or discipline specific content

5104343493E74686930AF979C9093919.description: Contribute to a reading and learning community

69D51149F5BB47AAAC22FFB797AB0EF8.description: Apply reading strategies to text structures and standard formats found in scholarly research studies across content areas within the field of study or academic discipline

193469EF63E4424AA14478CE29D14ACD.description: Apply reading strategies across the content areas

D04A1B93F9FB4337BA4D47FCEC270D8A.description: Build reading skills and behaviors for lifelong learning

3DDCDC4276D643F987BC06BFF3CDCD71.description: Identify how an author or authors, including organizations and companies as authors, write with a variety of purposes and for particular audiences, and evaluate effectiveness of text to purpose within the field of study or discipline specific content

5579F7C84CF242C9960BCCE8B84ECEC8.description: Set a reading purpose for reading a particular text, and vary the reading strategies to fit the purpose within the field of study or discipline specific content

C067C42A94A648AAA780E43D6F9F0DA4.description: Read to understand history, current events, and to make personal decisions

83DA69B4BBEE462A9966F5BEF17F60A1.description: Critically analyze and evaluate the information presented in an information source, to locate evidence for building and supporting demonstrate an understandings of texts, use comparisons to identify similarities or differences, ask inquiry questions when something from the text inspires seeking new knowledge within the field of study or discipline specific content

028229CC058D4C68BD090FDEC3C31F1F.description: Demonstrate reading for meaning by evaluating evidence, drawing conclusions, and forming opinions

EC717D0D225B415787B312A82A40B886.description: Monitor reading processes and identify problems, ask questions about the author’s ideas, use strategies to repair comprehension, summarize key points and reflect on important information in the text, within the field of study or discipline specific content

C8F6B55D7B5E4E25902BE0B0EEE1A571.description: Demonstrate reading for meaning by finding the main and supporting details

8969A6C4835649BBB1C55ECDEEACD823.description: Surface background knowledge that will connect to new information, in order to revise schema, develop a clearer understanding, and build reading fluency within the field of study or discipline specific content

2A45D0EEBE204D1EB2C6D7B3284A0B82.description: Read, listen to, view, and integrate information to build background knowledge

F56F41D216434DF0B8B163A64B8D3B88.description: Comprehend, interpret and evaluate informational and fictional text

45587F838E2748B29E0F8DFBC746F506.description: Seek diverse and inclusive perspectives, be open to new ideas, demonstrate an understanding of how selection of reading material within the field of study, or discipline specific content, affects the reader and can be empowering both personally and globally

768F9914307B4C22ABF37EE759D3C740.description: Read to seek multiple diverse and inclusive perspectives

D3420E8582F4451B87EF55DECC87BE72.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the author's craft including language choices, or scientific names and labels, that shape meaning, and identify the narrative voice, and the authorial voice (including historical contextualization where relevant), which shape the relationship between author and reader

8EC072BB65DB4FAE83899CB3CFED4D5B.description: Appreciate and evaluate author's craft and use of literary devices

49F95FEB554F463BBF5510B6C098C847.description: Reflect in discussions, and in writing, personal growth as a reader within a discipline specific or professional/technical context, and demonstrate an understanding of how information sources may incorporate or promote social, historical, economic, political and cultural commentary

35739E0458604D83BD1625011053BD8E.description: Explore text to text, text to self, and text to world connections

D546028AB08E476EAE0F933688DFA207.description: Recognize and demonstrate an understanding that information sources invite inference and interpretation within and across texts and experiences, to consider others’ evidence-based inferences and interpretations, and to synthesize relationships among personal ideas, ideas from texts, and ideas from discussions

186F4B052298483F9CB91D244E1310D6.description: Read to answer questions, make decisions, or solve problems

B69B59D202C949578ADE38DC1BEDF1B8.description: Recognize universal themes within the field of study, or discipline specific content, and trace their development in information sources

2F461DD90D5742B188C5CA72BC15183C.description: Identify, reflect upon and respond to works which exemplify the human experience

38A6DDC6D0694183BAD697E5F54EB62E.description: Select and read increasingly complex text within the field of study, or discipline specific content, and develop a reading literacy agenda

3BD0A11EA146433B99946C6C8A95A073.description: Read, listen to, and view a variety of genres and formats

070278B0D6B04CA3A96B682F6994F065.description: READING ENGAGEMENT Read to pursue lifelong intellectual, personal, and emotional growth

DF9572AA7B0C494D9C811473B5238896.description: Use a discipline specific or professional/technical framework to track the acquisition of new understanding and to evaluate the effectiveness of a created product

ED65E1DD15D548BBABAE62CBCA85F6D1.description: Reflect on a product's effectiveness in expressing and demonstrating new understandings

CDD0A443C8F041C38339C0EBE96B610D.description: Within a field of study, rhetorical or discipline specific content group, set up a shared plan, use project management skills to equitably share new understandings, and create and share content in collaborative groups

038107EC39A440A6AA9CFCCF0BA99AB8.description: Collaborate with others to create original products and share new understanding

169E9C265BC54B8D8F629001F0C211D2.description: Select the most appropriate tools to create and to share work, based on purpose and audience, for online or in-person presentation

87BD76B1EC1C48A6BBF443969C93FBA9.description: Use appropriate tools to create and share new work

20547E52FBE642F5978FB0697B9FB454.description: Analyze delivery formats for usefulness, adaptability, and appropriate format to communicate demonstrate an understanding in a discipline specific or professional/technical area

FF4AA04FB73C4168B133DB1D7FB0CA3D.description: Analyze delivery formats for sharing understanding

2223A0685DAB4F659A91D2E9A5087276.description: Use skills, resources, and tools to create and share work that expresses and demonstrates new understandings

715946F074574A46AEA7EFE7D939949C.description: Reflect on the development of new knowledge in a topic from a discipline specific, or professional/technical area, and evaluate the effectiveness of the strategies and tools used in a research process

48F5A48457D14FDF8A7433FA3FE8A990.description: Evaluate the effectiveness of the skills and tools used to create new knowledge

B447337E25C24E4DA45B6C6389E31E00.description: Make and defend informed conclusions based on complex criteria including rigorous research methods, locating corroborative and tested evidence, and considering criteria specific to a discipline or professional/technical area

6C201DAA728045E182F8FFF1441D250B.description: Reach and defend informed conclusions based on best evidence

27AD37FDA43741DEA674E96AAC57A4E3.description: Share experiences, participate in decision-making, and collaboratively identify methods of assessing the usefulness of ideas and sources, to build new knowledge, create new works, and solve problems, informed by the norms and expectations of a discipline or professional/technical area, in order to build new knowledge and solve problems

E6236E0B63EA4C82979E4019B0C9BB84.description: Collaborate with others to exchange ideas, develop new understandings, make decisions, and solve problems

0233D08F34E44F75AB65665CFC297F2D.description: Make personal connections to topics of interest (personal experience, expertise, interest in new ideas and for academic or personal development) in order to locate and use information from more than one discipline specific or professional/technical level source , to extend complexity in thinking about a current event, social issue or other real-world problem, to generate solutions with insight and synthesis

D697277FBD954D62AFD9C642DE61D1DB.description: Use information to solve real-world problems and inspire further investigation

BC3BEC618F334901851EC449E8B27D95.description: Answer questions using information (quoted or paraphrased correctly) in proper context, providing attribution using varied and multiple sources in a discipline or professional/technical area

EFD1434594164BCEAF127F9FFC70258A.description: Use information to answer questions and inspire further investigation

C3CF24CC2C604E1C940446FFC1C10496.description: Use tools to concurrently organize, analyze, and synthesize information in a discipline specific or professional/technical context

B800CB9AC65146BFA99334DD278B3A08.description: Analyze, organize, and synthesize information using a variety of tools

EA273FE73BB54FABA99CD1C7FD1A32F1.description: To make an informed decision, evaluate information, examine multiple positions, points of view, forms of argument, and challenge one’s assumptions including confirmation bias and to change a thesis when the predominance of evidence from reliable sources contradicts one’s initial hypothesis

DC415131643A462AB87D421E0A857B1B.description: Analyze and evaluate information to make informed decisions

40B01BBC0DE349CDAD9EC8C2C66C2075.description: Analyze subtleties, complexities, varying views, reasoning, discipline specific or professional/technical discussion, results, and evidence to draw conclusions

8314D822D54147F480E1383EFFA51114.description: Analyze and evaluate information to draw conclusions

CB237DAE20CE4AB69B8ABF1FCDE4433A.description: Use skills, resources, and tools to draw conclusions, make informed decisions, create new knowledge and apply knowledge to new situations

58E2871213F44F39A2582BDDF0AC1960.description: Reflect on the effectiveness of a research process including problem solving, and progress through developing a topic into a disciplinary or professional/technical researchable question

E781194A8CBA4CF7AAF48AD8D1557E95.description: Assess the effectiveness of questions, strategies, and processes used in research to find information

04F24E6DAD3D49EBAE63E1410A70265C.description: Collaborate with others within digital and physical environments to create content, developing discipline-specific or professional/technical knowledge by working through threshold concepts and metaliteracies

305108E1A67246FE8ECBDC5D082620C9.description: Collaborate to broaden and deepen understanding

DAD0F7F873FA49E494C206FE473224E6.description: Compare and use sources from a variety of digital formats and select the most appropriate for a specific purpose within a discipline-specific or professional/technical context

21BD232B6B544767B5639C6A77FFE218.description: Read, view, and listen to information in a variety of formats

2C9A3ACA4AC040CB9311BEC0203DB301.description: Evaluate information for accuracy, validity, importance, and bias, using increasingly complex qualifiers for professional/technical focus

E5FE32789189442DBD992B25A7D446DE.description: Evaluate information for accuracy, validity, importance, and bias

9394CE8ACD80479BA1761FEDBC368E4F.description: Select and use effective tools and source types with specific conventions, to access information, including specialized, subject-specific, and scholarly sources

46263667C7EA4142930D8986E621266E.description: Select and use tools within sources to access content

E3221DD585A24EA1AD1DFCE69F757FE5.description: Read laterally to evaluate the reliability of information, and evaluate sources for usefulness, reliability, author's expertise, frequency of citation, and position within the scholarly conversation

213AE001AE8C4B23A26FE781136C3D7A.description: Find, evaluate, and select appropriate sources to answer questions

4D211C0453E54F8B8B27D8D7E11B9CD6.description: Use advanced search strategies and different types of search language (controlled vocabulary, natural or colloquial language, keywords) for different applications in discipline specific, technical area, or discourse community

F6B7AA6F5AB843CD9D51A04815E31176.description: Develop, select, clarify, and use strategies to search for information

6A30BF568EAF47BAB367DA184204FBB6.description: Generate questions related to as well as embedded within a focused topic statement, relevant to a particular discourse community or discipline, and evaluate those questions for perspective and point of view, and synthesize to a researchable question which addresses a problem or issue

798ABFEE0F1F4650966FE6F879B66E4B.description: Develop, select, clarify, and use questions to search for information

342721BE61D1496BB1C72D468CA4E985.description: Use divergent thinking (brainstorming, lateral thinking) and metacognitive reflection to surface prior knowledge related to a new rhetorical or discipline specific problem, identify points of personal connection to apply to new knowledge, consider accuracy of prior knowledge, and to extend perceptions to include additional perspectives for next steps in research

8B5B9F851856436B8F4A4A9EAFF2D824.description: Apply prior knowledge to new learning

0F0ADE909A7B43B8ABE2703365A6DDBE.description: Develop a research question for inquiry within a particular discipline or professional/technical area

085E639F69064820A4927280F7A09F15.description: Follow an inquiry-based process to seek knowledge

B199B0C736664578800C8055824AF472.description: Use skills, resources, and tools to inquire, think critically, and gain knowledge

C83C0254873844538D7F90C94816BF3C.description: INFORMATION LITERACY: Use strategies for locating, selecting, organizing, understanding, evaluating, using, and producing information, within physical and digital information environments
